aibrain

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    The model representing the state of a game. This must be mutable, and must be able to be deeply copied by the GameCloner you provide.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendActionsForPlayer(java.util.List<Action> actions, Player player) 
      void endRound()
      End one round of the game, as though the "end turn" button was pressed.

      Game imageForPlayer(Player player)

    • Method Detail

      • isLive

        boolean isLive()
        Returns:
        true if the game is the "real" version that the player will see. Used mostly for debugging.

      • getPlayers

        java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()

      • setLive

        void setLive(boolean live)

      • setActionsForPlayer

        void setActionsForPlayer(java.util.List<Action> actions,
                         Player player)

      • appendActionsForPlayer

        void appendActionsForPlayer(java.util.List<Action> actions,
                            Player player)

      • endRound

        void endRound()
        End one round of the game, as though the "end turn" button was pressed. This must modify the instance, and must clear out all player actions (or ensure they aren't carried into the next round by other means), as the AI brain will not do this automatically in order to avoid interfering with any other layers of AI.

      • nextRound

        Game nextRound()
        Returns:
        A copy of this game where endRound() has been called. Unlike endRound, this must NOT modify the instance.

      • imageForPlayer

        Game imageForPlayer(Player player)
        Parameters:
        player - Player who's perspective the game is viewed from.
        Returns:
        A modified copy of the game, accounting for any information that player is not privy to.
